meanings.sent1: The wearproof jacket kept me dry in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She bought a wearproof phone case to protect her device.
meanings.sent3: The wearproof shoes danced through the puddles without a care.
meanings.sent4: His wearproof shield blocked every attack from the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The wearproof material withstood the test of time.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to wear or damage.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to wearproof his new backpack before the hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to wearproof their products for better durability.
meanings.sent3: She wearproofed her favorite hat to keep it looking new.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter wearproofed the table with a strong varnish.
meanings.sent5: They wearproofed the walls to protect them from scratches.
